Well, i say again... one abomination is no excuse for another abomination.

Vlad has to consume 10% of his max HP for one of his main damage abilities that is meant to be spammed, only gets that heal every other cast, has no hard cc, has to use his one defensive tool (which costs a ton of his HP) or hit a fully charged E (costs 10% of his HP, can be blocked by minions) if he wants a soft CC that isn't even that strong, doesn't get a shield, doesn't have any dashes, has an absolutely atrocious early game and a mediocre mid game, has to hit 5 targets with his ultimate to get that healing number, doesn't get his empowered Q healing if he doesn't use it within a few seconds of getting the buff, and only gets that healing every other cast at best.

You can't just point to one ability value and say it's the same thing without comparing everything else the champions have available.

Ekko had his passive slow removed because he had "too much cc" for his mobility, healing, and shield. Keep in mind his heal is his ultimate and his shield have a very long cooldown.

Meanwhile Sylas has his shield on a much shorter cooldown, a knock up, a range slow and the one thing that can never be accounted or balanced for, whoevers ultimate he chooses to steal. High impact AP converted ultimates. He can have an AoE knock up, a Supression, or ranged nuke attached to that high CC, High mobility, High healing, and high shielding kit. He isn't just a swiss army knife of a champion, his kit on its own is strong enough to synergize well with every single ultimate in the game. Just disgustingly overloaded, I say remove the heal all together and put a bit more dmg in his kit and he will feel better.

It's just way too binary. It's downright pitiful when he's behind but beyond disgusting when he's ahead.

There's just no middle ground. It needs to scale more modestly to where being behind doesn't make it useless and being ahead doesn't make it bonkers.

Hell I'd say just remove rank scaling entirely. Make the healing scale with level and make ranking it up only increase the damage and lower the cooldown.

In all honesty I'd rather have a champion balanced around extremely strong cooldown-gated sustain, than around crazy burst in a rotation.

Sylas damage is quite mild so I feel like it's kinda fair he has high moments.

well, he is a diver?  people are more likely to build him bulky to take advantage of his high defenses and crowd control

something else that people likely have not noticed yet...his kit has not one but TWO auto attack resets in it which is some fairly high burst if you weave in auto attacks

let's say he's level 3 with 1 point in each ability

he moves in range to attack or his opponent engages him.  he auto attacks, w, auto, e, auto, q auto

if that trade happens, he's dealt (at least if I remember the reset system right), 3 to 4 minimum auto attacks, (which is 180 - 240), 30 + 60% ap minimum for his passive(at level 3), (45 to 90  +  60 to 120% ap ), 60 + 55% ap , 70 + 20% ap 

for a total of 385 to 490 + 195% ap to 255% AP even with just {{item:1056}} and AP runes, that brings the total up to potentially (as 33 AP with just basic stuff and still higher possible), 449 to 574 in one trade

for reference, talon can deal at level 2 :  85 + 200 bonus AD + 65 + 110% bonus ad + 120 + 100% bonus AD.  if we go by just stats and long sword, that's around 20 bonus AD and then 1 auto attack(70 + 20 = 90)  for a total of 440 plus any additional auto attacks 

talon can weave in a few auto attacks to amp it up more, but sylas has some rather high base damages and decent AP ratios for all that he can do

#this does not account for their runes either
